page.title: 16SHOTTENDANE FARM
page.content: THE FARM STRETCHES OVER 100 ACRES. ON THE FARM THERE ARE ABOUT 10 SHEEP,5 LAMBS 2000 CHICKENS, 50 CATTLE AND A COUPLE OF GEESE.THEY ALSO HAVE A FRUIT AND VEGETABLE GARDEN WHICH CONTAINS GOOSEBERRIES,CHERRIES,APPLES,PEAS,TO MATOES ETC.THE FARM COLLECTS ABOUT 1500 EGGS A DAY,BOTH BATTERY AND FREE-RANGE EGGS.THE CATTLE ARE USUALLY KEPT FOR THEIR BEEF AND NOT THEIR MILK. THE FARMHOUSES AND BARNS. THERE ARE ONLY TWO ACTUAL FARMHOUSES ON THE FARM WHICH DATE BACK FROM THE 17th CENTURY, BUT ARE KEPT IN BEAUTIFUL CONDITION, BUT THE OLD BARNS HAVE BEEN LEFT TO DETERIORATE. MOST OF THEM WERE MADE OF BRICK, WOOD AND SLATE. AT THE TIME WE VISITED THE FARM THEY WERE USED TO KEEP ANIMALS IN OR THEY WERE BLOCKED.
